div.p: Dear wife i thoug I i would drop a few lines to in form you that i am still a live we left Camp Chase on Tuesday Evening and got to Cincinnati the next morning About day light and we staid there two days and then left for this place we got here on Saturday after noon at about 4 oclock we had to Pay our way at that and it strapt me clear i want you to get one dollar and send it to me if you can I think you can get it from Lybrean Maxwell if he has got it by him I cant

well do with out I still want some tobacco and alittle paper ink postage Tell L Maxwell the word is that we will draw our year in a few days and i will send it to him if you cant get it you must not cry about it any way i will do the best i can with out it They say that Perry Schnner cant stand over to night i was to see him About one hour be fore i wrote this letter and his breath was verry short A hard he has bin out of his head for three days And nights i was with Him fisrt of last nigh my self he was talking all the

I wasnt to Time then and throwing himself about verry much How the boys does since i was there and tell me how the corn filled and so on And how you and Bently maid it about the pigs whether he bough them or not you will get a letter the new mail you can go up to .T.S. Mains and get my cloths any time you had better go soon there is a box of them there is 3 bundels besid mine Hatten Lasefr & G. Gavey mine is in the barfret sack and you will find my Picture in my coat pocket & John Memau

on a plate you must send it to his mother as soon as you can you and Isaiah had better take the buggy to fetch them down you must show Tom my Picture we my go to virgina There is some such talk there is ZL Sees on a steamboat on the warf now at this palce and there is about
